opinion.syllabus: An action at law cannot be maintained by copartners to recover a debt which has been discharged by one of them and paid by a set-off of his separate debt with his assent, when the defendant acted in good faith.
opinion.posture: ASSUMPSIT, by C. H. Chase and S. H. Chase, partners, for goods sold. After the sale of the plaintiffs' goods to the defendant, C. H. Chase and the defendant agreed that $150 of the price should be paid by the defendant's allowing that sum in payment of a debt of that amount due to him from C. H. Chase: and that agreement was executed, the defendant acting in good faith.
opinion.attorneys:
Osgood and L. W. Clark, for the plaintiffs.
Smith and Andrews, for the defendant.
opinion.opinion_text:
An action at law cannot be maintained by copartners to recover a debt which has been discharged by one of them, and paid by a set-off of his separate debt with his assent, when the defendantPage 184 acted in good faith. Homer v. Wood, 11 Cush. 62; Williams v. Brimhall, 13 Gray 462; Tay v. Ladd, 15 Gray 296; Greeley v. Wyeth, 10 N.H. 15.
Case discharged.
BINGHAM, J., did not sit.
